title: The Honest Truth About Rosemary Oil & Hair Growth
text:
The Honest Truth About Rosemary Oil & Hair Growth

FromÂ thickening shampoosÂ toÂ retinol (yes, retinol), the topic ofÂ hair growthÂ has been taking over TikTok for a while now, with countless solutions sitting under the hashtag. Rosemary oil is one of the buzziest topics in the lineup ofÂ viral ingredients, and TikTokers are dubbing it a one-way ticket toÂ growing your hairÂ naturally.

Racking up billions of views and counting, thereâ€™s a good reason why theÂ hashtag #rosemaryoilÂ is trending again: Like so many of the hyped up ingredients that came before it, a collective concern overÂ hair loss is fueling the demand. And whatâ€™s more appealing than a simple, natural remedy?

â€œBefore and aftersâ€ show impressiveÂ hair growthÂ results, but experts are warning that thereâ€™s more to the story. So isÂ rosemary oilÂ the silver bullet solution for hair growth, after all? Or is it a herb that could do your hair more harm than good?

Hereâ€™s what the experts think.

@fleureleanorgreen Do you do these things!!! ğŸ‘¸ğŸ½ğŸ‘¸ğŸ¼ @Nature Spell #naturespell #hairoiling #rosemaryandbatanaoil #hairwashday #spellthetea â™¬ original sound â€“ Fleur Green

What is rosemary oil?Â 

â€œRosemary oil is the oil from the rosemary plant, also known as rosmarinus officinalis L.,â€ explainsÂ ZoÃ« Passam, consultant trichologist atÂ Philip Kingsley. For years, the herb has been used to treat a host of ailments, for aromatherapy, skincare formulas, and haircare.

â€œRosemary has a long tradition of use as an importantÂ essential oilÂ for a wide range of issues, most famously to improve memory and concentration, which goes back as far as ancient Greece,â€ adds Alison Pawlus, principal scientistÂ at Aveda.

Itâ€™sÂ â€œnaturalâ€, tooÂ â€” perhaps one reason why the ears of TikTokers have pricked up. â€œThereâ€™s growing interest in finding naturally derived solutions to help with hair growth, either to promoteÂ longer, healthier hairÂ or in individuals withÂ hair thinning,â€ explains Pawlus.Â 

@ree.adel The TRUTH about *Rosemary oil* for Hair Growth ğŸ‘€ğŸ’• you NEED to know this ğŸ«  #hairtok #hairgrowth #hairgrowthtips #hairoil #rosemaryoil @Boots UK â™¬ original sound â€“ Dr Ree

What are the benefits of rosemary oil for hair?Â 

Rosemary oil has a host of potential benefits. â€œIt contains compounds which have been shown to have some anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial and antioxidant activities,â€ explainsÂ Dr. Sharon Wong, consultant dermatologist and hair specialist. All such properties reduceÂ scalp irritation, while antioxidants specifically help protect your hair from external aggressors such as pollution. Put simply, this tends to equal stronger strands andÂ a healthier scalp.

â€œRosemary oil can help with nourishment and locking inÂ the hairâ€™s moisture,Â and it has properties that improveÂ blood circulation to the scalp, while getting rid of any bacteria that clog hair follicles,â€ addsÂ Hannah Gaboardi, leading trichologist and brand ambassadorÂ at Viviscal.

@likakiesow Everything you need to know about Oiling your ScalpğŸ«¶ğŸ¼ let me know if it is Helpful âœ¨ #hairoilingmistakes #hairoilingtutorial #oilingscalp #oilingthescalp #oilinghaircare #oilinghairroutine #hairtutorial #rosemaryoil #rosemaryoilforhairgrowth #rosemaryoilforgrowth â™¬ The Greatest-Sia â€“ Ellenâ€™s Betta

Is rosemary oil good for hair growth?

There has been some data that suggests rosemary oil could be good for hair growth, with two specific studies that point to its potential. â€œAÂ study in 2015Â compared the effects of rosemary oil versusÂ 2% minoxidilÂ [a topical medication] for the treatment ofÂ androgenetic alopeciaÂ [male and female pattern hair loss] and, after six months, found a similar increase in hair counts with both treatments,â€ says Passam. AnotherÂ study foundÂ that rosemary [essential] oil was an effective treatment for the patchy hair loss condition known asÂ alopecia areata.

Though promising, these studies are small, and the scientific researchis still preliminary. To add, the data is directed towards genetic hair loss (androgenetic alopecia) as opposed to analyzing specific types. Pawlus adds that rosemary oil has several beneficial compounds, but these studies speak exclusively of the essential oil, which is â€œthe volatile, aromatic component of plants [what you smell], which excludes some of rosemaryâ€™s powerful antioxidants.â€

The issue? TheÂ quality of the oilÂ can vary. â€œIt depends on many factors, including the growth conditions of the plant, the quality of the plant collected, and how it was handled prior to extraction,â€ says Pawlus.

@saloniverse I think it worked.. #rosemaryoil #hair #hairgrowth #damagedhair #healthyhairtips #haircare #haircareroutine #hairtok #hairstrengthener #shinyhair â™¬ original sound â€“ Saloni

Is it safe to use rosemary oil on your hair and scalp?

The experts say that, in theory, people withÂ all hair typesÂ can use rosemary oil, but some may want to proceed with caution. â€œAlthough natural, as with all plant extracts and botanicals, rosemary oil extracts and the raw material itself can potentially causeÂ skin irritationÂ and allergicÂ contact dermatitisÂ in some people,â€ explains Dr. Wong.

A possible catalyst for irritation is when using the oil alone. Despite what the TikTok videos might suggest, pure rosemary essential oil (andÂ essential oilsÂ in general) is very potent and could cause scalp irritation. Worse yet, it might have the opposite of the intended effect. â€œMaintaining aÂ healthy scalpÂ plays a fundamental role in supporting healthy hair growth by providing conditions to optimize the function of the hair follicle,â€ adds Dr. Wong. â€œThere are many examples in which an unhealthy scalp can lead to increased hair lossÂ such as eczema, psoriasis, fungal infections, orÂ yeast overgrowth.â€

To that end, if you are going to use rosemary oil, make sure youâ€™re diluting it with another oil-based product and massaging it into your scalp, says Gaboardi. â€œI recommend mixing four or five drops with a teaspoon of oil, likeÂ coconut oil. You can then massage it evenly into your scalp.â€ It is also said that the massaging action might be the catalyst for stimulating hair growth. â€œScalp massaging can helpÂ increase hair thicknessÂ by stretching the cells of hair follicles, which then stimulates the follicles to produce thicker hair,â€ says Gaboardi. Never apply rosemary oil to inflamed or broken skin, adds Passam.

How do you use rosemary oil for hair growth?Â 

Aside from diluting it, not all rosemary oil formulas are created equal. Though skeptical about using rosemary oil as a hair growth treatment altogether, Passam suggests itâ€™s best applied as a leave-in product so that it has a greater chance of exerting its effects. â€œI would always recommend using rosemary oil in conjunction with other products [suchÂ as shampoosÂ and serums] that support hair growth,â€ adds Gaboardi, who says aÂ balanced dietÂ andÂ supplementation are key.

Though plenty of new videos are surfacing to set the record straight, the misinformation thatâ€™s being bandied about on TikTok is exactly whatâ€™s causingÂ concern among experts. Lack of education aside, many donâ€™t look at the root of the problem. â€œAs a trichologist, my main concern would be that people may follow these trends when they would be better served finding out the reason for their hair loss and addressing this under the guidance of a specialist,â€ says Passam. â€œSome types of hair loss are progressive, so seeking appropriate advice early is likely to lead to better outcomes,â€ she adds.

This isnâ€™t to say that rosemary oil doesnâ€™t have a place in yourÂ haircare routine, but more research is needed to understand whether it can really promote hair growth and density. For now, quality control and education is your best bet to determine whether you might want to try it out for yourself.

title: The Moment Doesnâ€™t Take Charli XCX Seriously & Neither Should We
text:
The Moment Doesnâ€™t Take Charli XCX Seriously & Neither Should We

Mild spoilers ahead. Charli XCX hates being famous. Sheâ€™s also terrified of becoming irrelevant. She loves pop music but couldnâ€™t care less about being a pop star. She thinks the word â€œcuntâ€ is cool, but â€œbitchâ€ is cringe. Well, at least this is the Charli XCX we see in The Moment, a satirical mockumentary that takes aim at the music industry, standom, and how both treat the artists at their center. As a heightened version of herself in the Aidan Zamiri-directed film, Charli XCX is at once a decisive musician who knows exactly what her image should be, and a distressed pop pawn torn between label requests and capitalistic endeavors to turn her viral â€œbrat summerâ€ into a booming brand. The Moment, which premiered this weekend at the Sundance Film Festival in Park City, Utah, finds Charli XCX at a crossroads; sheâ€™s ready to say goodbye to her seminal 2024 album Brat but anxious about what comes after your entire career has been whittled into a neon(ish) shade of green and an indescribable aesthetic. What happens when you become a punchline?Â 

The answer, according to Charli and the team behind A24â€™s The Moment, is to start making the jokes yourself. The Moment is at its best when it doesnâ€™t take itself seriously, when it leans into being a searing commentary on fame and stardom, and when it makes fun of Brat Summer, a concept that (aside from the music, which was very good) already feels like it was a fever dream/ recession indicator of a lost era, even though it was just about 20 months ago. Brat Summer existed in the â€œpost-pandemicâ€ rarified space of hopefulness America seemed to have before Trump was re-elected, when partying was back, and our feeds felt less dystopian. Lest we forget, a core tenet of the Brat era was that it was fun, and for the most part, The Moment is too. The film takes us back to 2024, right before Charli XCX is to tour the album, when the Brat phenomenon is on its last legs. The film is ruthless in its depiction of record execs, the business side of the music industry, and the commodification of artists â€” as it should be. As her image is being chopped, skewed, and sold for parts, Charli (a genuinely good actor) toggles between aloof disinterest and manic frustration. So how much of the real Charli XCX is in The Moment?Â 

â€œThe thing about Charli isâ€¦ sheâ€™s so authentically herself, and sheâ€™s not afraid to open up and show you all the moving parts inside of her,â€ Charliâ€™s co-star, Isaac Powell, said on the Sundance red carpet at the premiere of The Moment. â€œI felt like I got to know the real [Charli] and youâ€™ll see the real her in this movie. Sheâ€™s an open book. I donâ€™t think anyone will be surprised by anything.â€

The most surprising thing about The Moment isnâ€™t who Charli is â€” or isnâ€™t â€” pretending to be, but who she says sheâ€™s not. Charli XCX isnâ€™t the kind of pop star who likes pyrotechnics or stunts where sheâ€™s suspended in the air wearing sparkles and harnessed to an apparatus. Sound familiar? Charli XCX is probably never going to confirm or deny if the jabs at packaged pop princesses that are made in the film are direct hits on Taylor Swift (who allegedly dissed Charli on her most recent album), but it was surprising to me how unsubtle they were. Swift has produced many over-the-top concert films. When a trailer for Charli XCXâ€™s fake music film drops in The Moment, it looks like itâ€™s ripped from the Disney Plus discover page trying to redirect you to watch the Eras Tour. Itâ€™s very Swift-coded to say the least. But Swift isnâ€™t the only pop star to make a concert doc, and sheâ€™s not the only one who dons a sequinned mic and suspends in the air over her fans during her acts. Sheâ€™s not the only billionaire poster child for how pop music has become a marketing machine more concerned with bottom lines than quality music. It could just be a coincidence, right?Â  â€” or Charli XCX and Taylor Swift are engaged in a pop star petty-off. I, for one, am here for it. If Swift can (allegedly) throw shots at Charli XCX, why shouldnâ€™t she shoot back?Â 

The Moment star Tish Weinstock said the confusion over what is a performance and whatâ€™s not in the film is the point. â€œThe fact that itâ€™s all a performance is very telling,â€ Weinstock said at the premiere. â€œI think the tension lies in trying to find out the truth. Do you ever know anyone? Every day people are performing who they are, and this movie is a commentary on that.â€

Charliâ€™s performance of who she is in The Moment isnâ€™t always a flattering one. When she blows off her creative director (played excellently by Hailey Benton Gates, giving a nuanced, exasperated yet restrained performance that sometimes outshines its material) in the middle of tour rehearsals to go to a wellness spa in Ibiza, Charli XCX is being a brat â€” and not in the coked-out, absurdist chic way she intended. Charli is running from fame, and she runs into Kylie Jenner, naturally (Rachel Sennott and Julia Fox also deliver strong cameos). Itâ€™s a bit on the nose to include a Kardashian, the first family of being famous for fameâ€™s sake, but somehow it works. Jenner surprisingly holds her own while presumably also playing a heightened version of herself. Sheâ€™s passive aggressively pissed at Charli for stealing the in-demand director Kylie and her sister (she didnâ€™t specify which one) wanted for their own project. This causes Charli to spiral, and to call her team demanding they give the hotshot director, who has been tapped for Charliâ€™s concert film, anything he wants. The director, Johannes, is played by Alexander SkarsgÃ¤rd who is having the time of his life in this role.

Johannes acts as a stand-in for all the shitty men women in music have to deal with, the ones who condescend, belittle, mansplain, and gaslight. He does all that cloaked in therapy speak and bad clothes. SkarsgÃ¤rd is truly hilarious â€” albeit disturbing â€” in the role. Itâ€™s in the scenes with Johannes, the gaggle of other bros, and Rosanna Arquetteâ€™s clueless record executive, who each are attempting to sell, monopolize and destroy Charliâ€™s image, that the movie finds its footing. The movie is a ridiculous takedown of how silly this industry is, and how unserious Brat Summer was. When sheâ€™s at her most self-deprecating, The Momentâ€™s Charli XCX is extremely likeable, and the world sheâ€™s critiquing is all about extremes.Â 

â€œFame is sacrificing your privacy but also getting everything that you want,â€ Weinstock said when asked to describe fame and the filmâ€™s explanation of it. â€œDeal with it.â€Â 

As Charli XCX deals with it, sheâ€™s grappling with having it all while wanting none of it. The last act of the film could be interpreted as a sincere rumination on the mental toil of massive success, and the loss of creative freedom, but itâ€™s also where the movieâ€™s message gets muddled. It may seem hard to feel bad for someone who got everything she wanted, but the genuine emotions that Charli the actress delivers help you root for this anti-heroine, even when youâ€™re rooting for her multi-million dollar Brat credit card deal not to fall through. The viewer gets just as caught up in the allure of Chari XCX as the parasocial stans sheâ€™s referencing. But Charli XCX is taking the piss out of herself, her fans, and their co-dependency. She can leave the sincerity for the sparkly pop stars.Â 

Deadline called The Moment a â€œspiritual sequel to Spice Worldâ€ and Iâ€™ll go further and call it Spice World meets Uncut Gems. Complimentary! Ultimately, Charli XCXâ€™s fans will love her irreverent approach and newcomers will be endeared by her self awareness. Thereâ€™s a scene near the beginning of the film where Charli asks one of her team members if something related to Brat Summer was too cringe. They reply, â€œItâ€™s all cringe.â€ Making a meta anti-concert film to say goodbye to an era that had cable news debating whether the Vice President was â€œbratâ€ is a little cringe. The Momentâ€™s Charli XCX would lean into it. Sure, itâ€™s all cringe, but cringe sells, and thatâ€™s all that matters.Â 

The Moment is in theaters on January 30.Â

I Went To A Charli XCX Metaverse Concert

Charli XCXâ€™s Taylor Swift Comments Spark Anger In

Charli XCX "Alone Together" New Music Doc

title: Your Horoscope This Week: January 25 To 31
text:
Your Horoscope This Week: January 25 To 31

R29 babes, the week opens under the influence of a first quarter moon in Taurus on January 25th, a moment that often brings the first real tests of the intentions we set at the Capricorn New Moon one week earlier. First quarter moons tend to surface friction, delays, or reality checks that ask us to adjust rather than abandon our goals. In Taurus, those roadblocks can feel especially personal, touching on money, security, self-worth, or comfort.

The shadow here is digging in too hard, insistingÂ itâ€™sÂ your way or the highway, or confusing stability with stubbornness. But the gift of thisÂ lunationÂ is learning how toÂ stay committed without becoming rigid. Progress now comes from flexibility,Â patience, and choosing long-term alignment over short-term control.Â 

The most defining shift of the week arrives on January 26th at 12:34 p.m. EST, when Neptune enters Aries, beginning a brand-new thirteen-year chapter for the collective. This marks a major transition away from Neptune in Pisces, which emphasized dreaming, dissolving, and spiritual sensitivity since 2011, sometimes without follow- through. Neptune in Aries is aboutÂ initiatingÂ the dream, embodying it, and fighting forÂ a vision rather than passively hoping for one.Â Weâ€™reÂ moving out of the influencer era and deeper into a protagonist era, where more people feel called to live their own stories instead of consuming someone elseâ€™s.Â 

On a global level, this transit carries weight. Aries is ruled by Mars, and Neptune here can inspire movements, conflicts, and ideological battles driven by belief as much as reality. The shadow is dreaming up chaos, glorifying dominance, or leadersÂ competing to prove who is strongest, especially as Saturn prepares to join Neptune in Aries next month. The invitation, both personally and collectively, is to dream new worlds responsibly. To believe in yourself enough toÂ take actionÂ without turning that fire into destruction. To choose courage without self-sabotage, and passion without violence.Â 

The week closes by pointing us toward what comes next. February begins with a fiery Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, a striking contrast to the Earth, Air, and Water-heavy energy that has dominated January. Where January opened with a cleansing Cancer Full Moon, February begins with bold, expressive fire. This Leo Full MoonÂ illuminatesÂ confidence, creativity, leadership, and the desire to be seen. At its best, it reminds us that playing small no longer serves anyone, and that joy, pride, and self-expressionÂ are not selfish.Â 

The shadow of this full moon is ego, control, or needing all eyes on you at theÂ expense of others. The work is finding the balance between honoring your needs and remembering that true leadership inspires rather than dominates. This Full Moon asks one simple but powerful question as we move forward: where are you finally ready to take up space, unapologetically and with heart?Â 

Read your horoscopes for your Sun and Rising signs for the most in-depth forecast.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Aries Sun & Rising:

Aries, welcome to your main character era, officially unlocked. This week marks the start of one of the most important transits of your lifetime as Neptune enters your sign on January 26th, where itâ€™ll remain for the next thirteen years. This is huge. Neptune in Aries is about turning dreams into action, and for you, it feels like the universe handing you the creative director chair of your own life. Your intuition sharpens, your vision expands, and suddenly the future feels less abstract and more achievable. Youâ€™re being asked to dream boldly and act bravely, but the challenge is staying grounded while you do it.

Neptune can blur lines, so there may be moments where you feel invincible oneÂ minute and impatient the next when things do not move fast enough. Pace yourself.Â Manifestation is not a sprint. When you pair faith with follow-through, your abilityÂ to bring your dreams to life is far stronger now than it was even a few weeks ago.Â 

The fire only intensifies as the week leads into a Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, lighting up your sector of fate, romance, creativity, and joy. This is a chefâ€™s-kiss moment for self-expression, passion projects, and heart-led decisions. You may experienceÂ aÂ breakthroughÂ inÂ love,Â feelÂ seenÂ forÂ yourÂ talents,Â orÂ finallyÂ giveÂ yourself permission to take up more space without apology.Â 

At its best, this Full Moon reminds you that you deserve a life that excites you. The shadow of this lunation, however, is assuming everything should go your way instantly orÂ takingÂ setbacks personally. Confidence is magnetic, but entitlement blocks theÂ flow. Let this Full Moon fuel your courage, not your ego. When you stay open, playful, and patient, this fiery weekÂ setsÂ the tone for a powerful, purpose-driven chapter ahead.Â 

Taurus Sun & Rising:

Taurus, this week is quietly powerful, even if itÂ doesnâ€™tÂ scream for attention at first.Â With Neptune entering Aries on January 26th, your subconscious, rest, and healing sector is activated for the next thirteen years. This is less about loud manifestation and more about deep internal rewiring. Old fears, patterns, and self-sabotaging habits are readyÂ to dissolve, but only if you are willing to slow down and listen to what your inner world has been trying to say.Â 

Dreams may feel more vivid, intuition stronger, and your need for rest more non-negotiable. The magic here is subtle but real. When you give yourself permission to unplug, heal, and trust your instincts, you areÂ layingÂ the foundation for a futureÂ version of yourself that feels lighter, clearer, and more aligned.Â 

The energy peaks with the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, illuminating your home, family, and emotional foundations sector. This can bring a turning point around living situations, family dynamics, or your sense of belonging. You may feel ready to takeÂ up more space in your personal life or finally advocate for what you need emotionally.Â 

The shadow of this Full Moon is reacting from pride or stubbornness instead of vulnerability. Not every battle needs to be won, and not every feeling needs to be defended. Let this moment remind you that strength can look like softness too.Â When you balance emotional honesty with flexibility, this week helps you feel more secure, rooted, and at peace with where you are headed.Â Â 

Gemini Sun & Rising:

Gemini, your socialÂ lifeÂ and long-term dreams are entering a whole new era. With Neptune entering Aries on January 26th, your friendship, community, and future-goals sectorÂ getsÂ a major glow upÂ that lastsÂ for the next thirteen years. This transit invitesÂ you to dream bigger about the kind of people you want around you and the impactÂ you want to make.Â 

During Neptune in Aries, you may feel inspired to build something meaningful with others, whetherÂ thatâ€™sÂ a creative collective, a business idea, or a cause youÂ actually careÂ about. The magic here is believing in the vision without losing yourself in it.Â Neptune can blur boundaries, so be mindful of overcommitting or idealizingÂ people who have not shown consistency yet. DreamÂ big, butÂ choose your circle wisely.Â 

TheÂ weekÂ crescendos with the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, lighting up your communication, ideas, and self-expression sector. This is a powerful moment for speaking your truth, sharing your work, or finally saying the thing you have been holding back. Confidence is high, creativity is flowing, and your voice carriesÂ extra weight right now.Â 

The shadow side of this Full Moon is talking just to be heard or letting ego override empathy. Let this Full Moon remind you that your words have power. When youÂ speak from the heart instead of the highlight reel, peopleÂ actually listen. This is your moment to be seen and heard, just make sureÂ itâ€™sÂ for the right reasons.Â 

Cancer Sun & Rising:

Cancer, this week marks a major turning point in how you dream about your future and your role in the world. With Neptune entering Aries on January 26th, your career, purpose, and public image sector is activated for the next thirteen years. This is big. You are being invited to envision a version of success that feels meaningful, intuitive, and aligned with who you actually are, not just what is expected of you.

Under Neptune in Aries, you may feel more inspired about your path, but also more sensitive to whether your work truly reflects your values. The magic here is learningÂ toÂ trustÂ your vision while stayingÂ grounded in reality. Neptune can blur lines, so avoid romanticizing a role, title, or opportunity without checking whetherÂ itâ€™sÂ sustainable. When you pair intuition with discernment, your dreams become achievable ratherÂ thanÂ overwhelming.Â 

The energy peaks with the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, lighting up your money, self-worth, and abundance sector. This Full Moon asks you to own your value without shrinking or over-explaining. You may experience a financial breakthrough, a confidence boost, or a moment where you finally realize you deserve more thanÂ youâ€™veÂ been settling for.Â 

TheÂ shadowÂ sideÂ ofÂ thisÂ FullÂ MoonÂ isÂ tyingÂ yourÂ worthÂ tooÂ tightlyÂ toÂ externalÂ validation or spending impulsively to prove a point. Let this Full Moon remind you thatÂ abundance starts with self-trust. When you believe in yourself unapologetically, others follow yourÂ lead.Â 

Leo Sun & Rising:

Leo, this week is quietly redefining what expansion and purpose mean for you onÂ a soul level. With Neptune entering Aries on January 26th, your sector of travel, higher learning, spirituality, and belief systems is activated for the next thirteen years.Â Translation: your worldview is about to get a serious upgrade. You may feel calledÂ to explore new philosophies, spiritual practices, creative studies, or even literalÂ newÂ places.Â 

Neptune in Aries is a long-term invitation to dream bigger about your life and trustÂ that growth does not always come from staying comfortable. The challenge here is staying grounded while you explore. Neptune can blur direction, so it is important to stay curious without getting lost in fantasy. Think inspired, not impulsive.Â 

ThenÂ comesÂ theÂ momentÂ youÂ wereÂ bornÂ for.Â TheÂ FullÂ MoonÂ inÂ LeoÂ onÂ FebruaryÂ 1stÂ lands in your identity and self-expression sector, putting you front and center. This is a powerful checkpoint around confidence, visibility, and authenticity. You may feelÂ ready to claim space, be seen, or finally stop dimming yourself for the comfort of others.Â 

At its best, this Full Moon reminds you that you deserve to lead with heart and creativity. The shadow of the Full Moon in your sign is falling victim to ego overload, control issues, or needing constant validation. Let this be a moment of embodied confidence rather than performance. When you show up as your real self, not justÂ the highlight reel, your light hits different.Â 

Virgo Sun & Rising:

Virgo, this week marks the start of a deep, transformative era that asks you to trust what you cannot fully control. With Neptune entering Aries on January 26th, your sector of intimacy, shared resources, and emotional merging is activated for the next thirteen years. This is about redefining how you share, trust, and open yourself up, financially, emotionally, and energetically. You may feel more sensitive around boundaries or more aware of where youâ€™ve been over-giving. The magic here is learning that vulnerability does not equal weakness. The challenge is staying clear-eyed while you open your heart. Neptune can blur lines, so honesty, transparency, and self-trust are essential as you step into deeper connections and commitments.

The energy peaks with the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, illuminating your rest, healing, and subconscious sector. This Full Moon invites you to slow down and listenÂ to what your body and spirit have been trying to tell you. You may experienceÂ emotional releases, vivid dreams, or a realization about what you are ready to let goÂ of.Â 

The shadow of the Leo Full Moon is ignoring the need for rest or trying toÂ â€œoptimizeâ€ your healing instead of feeling it. Let this moment remind you that renewal does not come from doing more. When you honor rest as part of your process, youÂ emergeÂ clearer, stronger, and more aligned for what comes next.Â 

Libra Sun & Rising:

Libra, this week oï¬ƒcially changes the way you approach love, partnership, and commitment for the long haul. With Neptune entering Aries on January 26th, your relationship sector is activated for the next thirteen years. Yes, thirteen. This is a major reimagining of how you connect, collaborate, and share your life with others. You may feel more romantic, idealistic, or hopeful about love and partnership, but Neptune also asks for discernment.

The magic of this transit is believing in deep, soul-aligned connections withoutÂ losing yourself in them. The challenge is not projecting fantasies onto people who have not shown up consistently. Over the next chapter, you are learning that true partnership supports your independence rather than replacing it.Â 

The energy peaks with the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, lighting up your friendship, community, and long-term goals sector. This Full Moon brings clarity around who is reallyÂ inÂ yourÂ cornerÂ andÂ whichÂ connectionsÂ energizeÂ yourÂ future.Â YouÂ mayÂ feelÂ readyÂ to step into leadership within a group, celebrate a collective win, or finally distance yourself from social dynamics that feel draining.Â 

The shadow side of this moon is people-pleasing or craving approval instead of honoring your truth. Let this Full Moon remind you that belonging does not require shrinking. When you show up authentically, the right people naturally rise to meetÂ you.Â 

Scorpio Sun & Rising:

Scorpio, this week is about redefining what it means to show up for your lifeÂ on aÂ daily basis. With Neptune entering Aries on January 26th, your work, wellness, and routine sector is activated for the next thirteen years. This is a long-term invitation to stop runningÂ on autopilot and startÂ aligningÂ your everyday life with your deeper values. You may feel more sensitive to burnout, uninspired routines, or work that drains youÂ withoutÂ meaning.Â 

The magic of Neptune in Aries is learning to design a life that supports your energy,Â not just your ambition. However, you should beware of falling prey to escapism or avoiding structure altogether. Neptune wantsÂ flow, but Aries demands action. The sweet spot is intuitive discipline, building habits that feel purposeful rather than punishing.Â 

The energy crescendos with the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, lighting up your career, reputation, and public image sector. This can bring a moment of recognition, visibility, or clarity around your professional direction. You may feel ready to stepÂ into leadership or finally own your authority.Â 

The shadow of the Leo Full Moon is getting caught up in power struggles, egoÂ clashes, or feeling pressure to perform instead of lead authentically. Let this Full Moon remind you that confidence does not require domination. When you lead from integrity and emotional intelligence, your presence speaks louder than control ever could.Â 

Sagittarius Sun & Rising:

Sag, this week flips a major creative switch for you. With Neptune entering Aries on January 26, your sector of joy, romance, creativity, and self-expression is activated for theÂ nextÂ thirteenÂ years.Â Yes,Â thirteen.Â ThisÂ isÂ hugeÂ main-characterÂ energyÂ aroundÂ doing what lights you up andÂ actually believingÂ you deserve a life that feels inspiring.Â 

You may feel more artistically driven, more romantic, or more willing to take risks forÂ the sake of passion rather than practicality. The magic of this auspicious transit is trusting your creative instincts and letting play be productive. The shadow is chasing dopamine instead of fulfillment or romanticizing something that does not have real substance.Â DreamÂ big, butÂ stay honest with yourself about what is truly nourishing versusÂ justÂ exciting.Â 

The week builds toward the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, lighting up your travel, growth, and belief sector. This Full Moon can bring a breakthrough around purpose, perspective, or a bold decision about your future. You may feel ready to say yes toÂ an opportunity that expands your world or finally let go of a belief that has been keeping you small.Â 

The potentialÂ pitfallsÂ of this full moon is thinking you have all the answers or pushing your truth onto others. Let this moment remind you that wisdom grows whenÂ curiosity stays alive. When you lead with openness and confidence, the next chapter unfoldsÂ naturally.Â 

Capricorn Sun & Rising:

Capricorn, this week marks the beginning of a deeply emotional and transformativeÂ era around home, family, and your inner foundation. With Neptune entering Aries on January 26th, your sector of roots, living situation, and emotional security is activated for the next thirteen years. This is notÂ surface-level change.Â Youâ€™reÂ being asked to reimagine what â€œhomeâ€ means to you, not just physically, but emotionally andÂ energetically.Â 

With this new Neptune era, you may feel more sensitive to your environment, family dynamics, or where you truly feel safe. The magic of Neptune in Aries is learning that stability does not have to be rigid. The challenge is not escaping discomfort byÂ staying busy or emotionally distant. Over this long chapter, you are learning how to build a life that feels supportive from the inside out, not just impressive from the outside.Â 

The energy peaks with the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, lighting up your sector of intimacy,Â sharedÂ resources,Â andÂ emotionalÂ vulnerability.Â ThisÂ FullÂ MoonÂ asksÂ youÂ toÂ go deeper rather than harder. Conversations around trust, money, or emotional honesty may come to a head, oï¬€ering clarity about what needs to shift.Â 

The shadow side of thisÂ lunationÂ is control, pride, or trying to manage feelingsÂ instead of feeling them. Let this moment remind you that real power comes from allowing yourself to be supported too. When you soften where you normally armor up, you create space for deeper connection and long-term healing.Â 

Aquarius Sun & Rising:

Aquarius, your mind is entering a whole new era. With Neptune entering Aries on January 26th, your communication, ideas, and mindset sector is activated for the next thirteen years. This is big â€œthought leaderâ€ energy. Your words, ideas, and perspectives carry more imagination, influence, and emotional resonance than before. You may feel inspired to write, teach, speak, create content, or share ideas that feel deeply personal and purpose-driven.

The magic that Neptune in Aries brings is learning to trust your voice without over-editing yourself. The shadow is confusion, overthinking, or starting ten ideas without grounding any of them. Neptune wantsÂ vision,Â Aries wants action. When you commitÂ to one idea at a time, your messageÂ actually lands.Â 

The week culminates with the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, lighting up your relationship sector and bringing clarity to one-on-one dynamics. This Full Moon putsÂ a spotlight on partnerships, situationships, collaborations, and even creative rivals. You may realize who is truly cheering you on and who feels more competitive thanÂ supportive.Â 

The danger of this full moon is making everything about ego or control, either yoursÂ or someone elseâ€™s. Let this moment remind you that the best relationships celebrate individuality without turning love into a power struggle. When mutual respect leads, everything else falls into place.Â 

Pisces Sun & Rising:

Pisces, this week marks a major turning point in how you build security, confidence, and self-worth. With Neptune, your ruling planet, entering Aries on January 26th, your money, values, and self-esteem sector is activated for the next thirteen years. This is huge. Youâ€™re being asked to stop romanticizing struggle and start believing that you can be both spiritual and supported. You may feel inspired to pursue new income streams, charge what you are worth, or redefine what stability looks like for you.

The magic of Neptune transiting Aries is trusting that you deserve more than survival mode. The shadow side of this transit is drifting, underpricing yourself, or hopingÂ things will â€œjust work outâ€ without action. Neptune brings vision, but Aries demands courage. When you back your dreams with initiative, your relationship with abundance begins to change for real.Â 

The week builds toward the Full Moon in Leo on February 1st, lighting up your work, wellness, and daily routines sector. This Full Moon shines a light on how you are showing up for yourself day to day. You may realize that certain habits,Â commitments, or work dynamics are no longer sustainable.Â 

But beware, Pisces, as this Full Moon couldÂ lead toÂ you pushing through exhaustion for the sake of proving something. The breakthrough comes when you chooseÂ self-respect over self-sacrifice. Let this Full Moon remind you that you do not have to earn rest or care. When your daily life supports your energy, everything else flows more easily.

title: Tea Scents Are 2026â€™s Next Big Fragrance Trend
text:
Tea Scents Are 2026â€™s Next Big Fragrance Trend Hereâ€™sÂ the tea â€” no, really â€”Â onÂ 2026â€™s most excitingÂ fragrance trend.Â 2025 may have been the year ofÂ vanilla scents, but if we had toÂ call it early?Â Letâ€™sÂ just say that tea scents are about to beÂ everywhere.

Notes of teaÂ arenâ€™tÂ totally newÂ in the perfume world;Â Early adopters of the trend includeÂ Guerlain's AquaÂ AllegoriaÂ andÂ Elizabeth Arden'sÂ White Tea range,Â but the latest iterations borrow fromÂ modern sipsÂ ranging from chai toÂ matcha, and everything in between.Â (â€œThe earthy, green addition of matcha in a perfume can feel grounding and calming, taking you back to that matcha momentÂ in the morning,â€Â Michelle Feeney, founder of Floral Street, told us last year.)Â LikeÂ the signature brewed beverage, tea-infused fragrancesÂ across the boardÂ haveÂ a certain airyÂ lightness about themÂ (somewhat of a palate cleanserÂ compared to the polarizing, cloying nature of gourmands),Â andÂ generallyÂ arenâ€™tÂ the strong, heady types that can easily overpower a room. As such,Â theyâ€™reÂ ideal for wearing alone duringÂ the daytime or even layering with other perfumes to create aÂ bespoke result.

Not only is this a bourgeoning trendÂ withinÂ perfumery,Â butÂ itâ€™sÂ one that has made its way into R29 editorsâ€™ own routines for a much-needed moment of grounding and centering calm.Â Below,Â 12Â tea-infused fragrancesÂ thatÂ we'reÂ spritzing nonstop until further notice.Â

title: Why Is No One Talking About This Drugstore Skin Tint Stick?
text:
Why Is No One Talking About This Drugstore Skin Tint Stick?

IfÂ thereâ€™sÂ one thing to know about me,Â itâ€™sÂ that nothing makes my beauty editorÂ heart beatÂ faster than findingÂ aÂ drugstore diamond in the rough.Â Iâ€™veÂ always been that way; my first makeup memories were in the aisles of CVS and Target, and I still gleefully peruse the stacks while waiting for a prescription to be filled.â€¯Â 

My latest discovery comes in the form ofÂ Milaniâ€™s Conceal + Perfect Blur Out Skin Tint Stick, which IÂ found viaÂ makeup artist Alexandra Frenchâ€™sÂ (whose celebrity clients include Katy Perry, Mary Beth Barone, and Victoria Pedretti)Â rave reviewÂ (an essential follow, BTW!). Keep reading for everything to know about this IYKYK product.â€¯Â 

WhatÂ isÂ Milaniâ€™s Conceal + Perfect Blur Out Skin Tint Stick, and what are the benefits?â€¯Â 

Itâ€™sÂ all in the name, really: Milaniâ€™s Conceal + Perfect Blur Out Skin Tint Stick is a solid, cream-based product with the sheer, buildable coverage youÂ would expect from a skin tintÂ (and Iâ€™veÂ tried several!) withÂ a soft-matte finish.Â Many products claim to lend aÂ blurred,Â filter-like effect, but this one truly doesÂ â€”Â my pores and texture are almost undetectable when I have this on.Â It feels super lightweight on the skin, but is formulated with ingredients like moisturizing murumuru butter, strengthening vitamin E, and guava extract for a brightening boost of vitamin C.â€¯Â 

What makes Milaniâ€™s Conceal + Perfect Blur Out Skin Tint Stick special?â€¯Â 

From the first swipe, I knew Milaniâ€™s Conceal + Perfect skin tint stick was something special â€”â€¯I audibly gasped when I saw the flawless shade match and sophisticated demi-matteÂ finish. A little goes a long way (Iâ€™veÂ been testing mine forÂ maybe twoÂ months now and still have plenty of product left), so the value aspect of this is also a major plus.Â Â 

Iâ€™veÂ tried a fewÂ high-endÂ skin tint sticks ranging from Charlotte TilburyÂ to Dior, and Milaniâ€™s is by farÂ my favoriteÂ â€”Â and the least expensive.Â What I love most about it is that it really does have an optical blurring effect â€” seriously, where did my pores go? â€” and a matte, but not flat finish that my oily skin loves. You can alsoÂ layer this forÂ extraÂ coverage depending on how much you apply, but I usually will use a separate concealer in tandem with this ifÂ Iâ€™mÂ cravingÂ more coverageÂ around my forehead, chin, or nose.â€¯Â 

What to know about Milaniâ€™s Conceal + Perfect Blur Out Skin Tint Stick:â€¯Â 

â€“ Available in 25Â shadesâ€¯.Â 
â€“ Sheer, buildable coverage with a soft-matte finish.Â 
â€“ Packed withÂ moisturizingÂ skincare ingredientsÂ andÂ antioxidants.Â 

How do you useÂ Milaniâ€™s Conceal + Perfect Blur Out Skin Tint Stick, and is it worth it?Â 

After prepping my skin with my morning skincare routine â€”Â serum, moisturizer, andÂ sunscreen â€”Â and lettingÂ itÂ absorb, I likeÂ toÂ swipeÂ Milaniâ€™s Conceal + PerfectÂ Blur Out SkinÂ TintÂ StickÂ on the sides of my face, forehead, and chin.Â Then,Â IÂ blendÂ it outÂ eitherÂ with clean fingers or aÂ fluffyÂ brushÂ likeÂ e.l.f.â€™s Flawless Face Brush. It setsÂ within aÂ minute or so,Â but ifÂ youâ€™reÂ extra oily or want it to stay in place all day, I recommend finishing withÂ strategically placedÂ loose powder and/or setting spray. (Again, this isÂ totally optional!)Â My current favorites are theÂ Hourglass Veil Translucent Setting PowderÂ and theÂ Charlotte TilburyÂ Airbrush Flawless Matte Blur Setting Spray.Â 

At $18.49,Â itÂ performsÂ like a much more expensive product;Â itÂ glidesÂ onÂ smoothlyÂ butÂ doesnâ€™tÂ feel greasy or heavy at all.Â The coverage is also really customizable, allowing me to wear it as a true skin tint or as aÂ more comprehensive complexion product.Â While itÂ wonâ€™tÂ completely mask active breakouts or hyperpigmentation, it does do an excellent job filtering out things like texture and pores.Â 

Where can you get Milaniâ€™s Conceal + Perfect Blur Out Skin Tint Stick?â€¯Â 

Milaniâ€™s Conceal + PerfectÂ Blur Out Skin Tint StickÂ is available at most mass beauty retailers and drugstores, includingÂ Ulta Beauty,Â Amazon,Â Target,Â CVS, in addition toÂ Milaniâ€™s website.â€¯Â 

Final ThoughtsÂ 

TheÂ best compliment I can giveÂ Milaniâ€™s Conceal + Perfect Blur Out Skin Tint StickÂ isÂ thatÂ itâ€™sÂ not justÂ a good productÂ at a competitive price point;Â itâ€™sÂ a good productÂ that will upgrade your makeup routineÂ period.Â It checks so many of my boxes (notÂ superÂ expensive,Â inclusiveÂ shade range,Â doesnâ€™tÂ break me out,Â long-lasting) and is just soÂ good,Â I genuinelyÂ canâ€™tÂ believe more peopleÂ arenâ€™tÂ talking about itÂ â€”Â well, until now, that is.Â

title: Neptune In Aries Begins Its 14-Year Transit â€” & Youâ€™ll Experience Great Change
text:
Neptune In Aries Begins Its 14-Year Transit â€” & Youâ€™ll Experience Great Change

Elusive and empathetic Neptune is re-entering Aries on January 26th, offering us a second chance to understand the journey ahead. This time around,Â weâ€™llÂ go full throttle in Aries to find our path until March 2039. TheÂ nearlyÂ 14-yearÂ transit is augmenting the world and our lives.Â 

To understand how transit affects us,Â itâ€™sÂ essential to look to the past to gain a clearer perspective. When Neptune was previously in Aries,Â weâ€™veÂ seen reformation, uprisings, and advancements in society, particularly in the medical and scientific fields. Empires have risen, and others have fallen in history when Neptune has been in Aries.Â To sum it up, the good comes with its challenges â€” that is how Neptune rolls.Â Â 

Last year,Â NeptuneÂ made a quick entrance into Aries from March 30thÂ to October 22nd, then moonwalked back into Pisces. Â In questionable times, people have sometimes turned to mysticism to give them a sense of control and order amidst the political chaos. Spiritual Neptune urges us toÂ take action to changeÂ our lives by any means possible. We can expect more magic until 2039.Â 

One of the most important astrological transits of the year occurs on February 20th, when Neptune and Saturn link up in Aries. This planetary connection is set to bring sweeping changes to the collective, ushering in a new state of mind. A new era of creativity, innovation, and societal transformation is unfolding. The 1989 Neptune and Saturn conjunction in Sagittarius coincided with the fall of the Berlin Wall and the onset of the Velvet Revolution.Â Although the alignment of these two celestial entities occursÂ approximately everyÂ 36 years, it has been centuries since they last came together in Aries. The once-in-a-lifetime alignment of Neptune and Saturn in Aries is making our dreams a reality, as long as we approach our progress with pragmatism and remain committed to the cause.Â Â 

Take note: July is going to be aÂ stellarÂ month for Neptune in Aries! Neptune and Uranus in Gemini harmonize on July 15th,Â changingÂ the way we communicate with others. Neptune and Jupiter in Leo gently touch each other on July 20th, enhancing our compassion and artistry. Neptune and Pluto in Aquarius spark each other up on July 25th, rebirthing our ideology with novel perspectives.Â Weâ€™llÂ use our voice to fight authoritative forces and trust our intuition to guide us through challenging situations and choices.Â Â 

The following 13 years are going to intensify the effects of Neptune in Aries. But 2026 is going to bring us into a higher state of consciousness. We have until 2039 to figure out our next steps. For now, we must prioritize ourselves. We hold the ultimate power over our own success.Â Donâ€™tÂ forget that!Â
